what: Infer Copy-Number Alterations From Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data — Infercna
title: Infer Copy-Number Alterations From Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data — Infercna
text: Infer Copy-Number Alterations Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data

title: Infer Copy-Number Alterations From Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data — Infercna
code: Infercna(   expr_mat,   refCells = NULL,   window = 100,   range = c(-3, 3),   top_n = 3000,   noise = 0.1,   center.method = "median",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Infer Copy-Number Alterations From Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data — Infercna
text: expr_mat normalized expression matrix genes X cells containing scRNA-seq expression data. can TPM, RPKM, CPM etc. refCells list two character vectors, containg cell IDs normal cell types (one cell type per list element). Since cell types presumed normal cells, CNA values can used correct remaining CNA values. Note cell IDs correspond column names expr_mat. See Infercna::refCells (normal cells) example. Default: NULL window size window use rolling mean. Units number genes. Default: 100 range values expr_mat range set values range. See Infercna::clip() details. Default: c(-3, 3) top_n numeric value indicating top genes used CNA calculation many. n fraction 0 1, number genes included n * nrow(expr_mat). Else number genes included n. Default: 3000 noise numeric value, given, increases boundaries within CNA values considered 0. Increases <noise> .e. bounds become Minimum - noise Maximum + noise. Default: 0.1 center.method method center cells calculating CNA values. One 'median', 'mean', etc.... Default: 'median' verbose print progress messages. Default: FALSE

title: Infer Copy-Number Alterations From Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data — Infercna
text: matrix genes X cells inferred CNA values. Note n = (window - 1)/2 genes lost either extremity genome (ie. n genes lost start chromosome 1 end chromosome Y, genome question H.sapiens.)

title: Infer Copy-Number Alterations From Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data — Infercna
text: Correction reference cells' <refCells> CNAs: boundaries reference CNA values boundaries considered CNA 0. Thus, boundary -0.1 0.1, cell CNA = -0.5 corrected -0.4, cell CNA value 1 corrected 0.9 cell CNA value 0.05 corrected 0.

title: Infer Copy-Number Alterations From Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data — Infercna
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ m <- mgh125 cna <- Infercna(expr_mat = m, refCells = refCells, top_n = 3000) } # }

title: Cell - Tumour CNA Correlations — cnaCor
text: Compute pairwise correlations individual cells' CNA values average CNA values tumour origin.

title: Cell - Tumour CNA Correlations — cnaCor
code: cnaCor(   cna,   cor.method = "pearson",   cell.quantile = NULL,   gene.quantile.for.cells = NULL,   gene.quantile = NULL,   cell.quantile.for.genes = NULL,   refCells = NULL,   samples = NULL,   ... )

title: Cell - Tumour CNA Correlations — cnaCor
text: cna matrix gene rows cell columns containing CNA values. cor.method character string indicating method use pairwise correlations. E.g. 'pearson', 'spearman'. Default: 'pearson' cell.quantile calculate CNA measures including top / "hotspot" genes according squared CNA values across cells. Value 0 1 denoting quantile genes include. Default: NULL gene.quantile..cells calculate CNA measures including top / "hotspot" genes according squared CNA values across genes Value 0 1 denoting quantile genes include, matched `cell.quantile`. Default: NULL gene.quantile calculate CNA measures including top / "hotspot" genes according squared CNA values across cells. Value 0 1 denoting quantile genes include. Default: NULL cell.quantile..genes calculate CNA measures including top / "hotspot" genes according squared CNA values across genes Value 0 1 denoting quantile genes include, matched `gene.quantile`. Default: NULL refCells character vector cell ids exclude average CNA profile cell correlated . can pass reference normal cell ids argument known. Default: NULL samples CNA correlations calculated within cell subgroups, provide ) list cell id groups, ii) character vector sample names group cells , iii) TRUE extract sample names cell ids subsequently group. Default: NULL ... arguments passed unique_sample_names samples = TRUE.

title: Cell - Tumour CNA Correlations — cnaCor
text: numeric vector list numeric vectors

title: Visualise Malignant and Non-Malignant Subsets — cnaScatterPlot
text: cna matrix gene rows cell columns containing CNA values. cor.method character string indicating method use pairwise correlations. E.g. 'pearson', 'spearman'. Default: 'pearson' gene.quantile..cor CNA correlations specifically. Default: gene.quantile gene.quantile..signal CNA signal specifically. Default: gene.quantile refCells character vector cell ids exclude average CNA profile cell correlated . can pass reference normal cell ids argument known. Default: NULL samples CNA correlations calculated within cell subgroups, provide ) list cell id groups, ii) character vector sample names groups cells , iii) TRUE extract sample names cell ids subsequently groups. Default: NULL verbose print progress messages. Default: FALSE

what: Calculate the Means of Squared CNA Values — cnaSignal
title: Calculate the Means of Squared CNA Values — cnaSignal
text: Calculate Mean Squared CNA Values

title: Calculate the Means of Squared CNA Values — cnaSignal
code: cnaSignal(   cna,   gene.quantile = NULL,   cell.quantile.for.genes = NULL,   refCells = NULL,   samples = NULL,   ... )

title: Calculate the Means of Squared CNA Values — cnaSignal
text: cna matrix gene rows cell columns containing CNA values. gene.quantile calculate CNA measures including top / "hotspot" genes according squared CNA values across cells. Value 0 1 denoting quantile genes include. Default: NULL cell.quantile..genes calculate CNA measures including top / "hotspot" cells according squared CNA values across genes. Value 0 1 denoting quantile cells include. Default: NULL refCells character vector cell ids (e.g. normal reference cell ids) exclude calculation cnaHotspotGenes. relevant gene.quantile NULL. Default: NULL samples cnaHotspotGenes calculated within cell subgroups, provide ) list cell id groups, ii) character vector sample names group cells , iii) TRUE extract sample names cell ids subsequently group. Default: NULL ... arguments passed unique_sample_names samples = TRUE.

title: Calculate the Means of Squared CNA Values — cnaSignal
text: numeric vector CNA signal values Mean Squared CNA values

what: Plot A Heatmap with ggplot2 — ggheatmap
title: Plot A Heatmap with ggplot2 — ggheatmap
text: `ggheatmap()` create heatmap ggplot2 object. Uses `ggplot::geom_raster` generate plot copy number aberration (CNA) values. Delineates chromosomes chromosome arms, provides options clustering cells groups cells (e.g., cell types, samples, subclones) prior plotting.

title: Plot A Heatmap with ggplot2 — ggheatmap
code: ggheatmap(   dat,   x = Var1,   y = Var2,   fill = value,   x.num = TRUE,   y.num = TRUE,   limits = c(-1, 1),   limits.find = FALSE,   limits.symmetric = FALSE,   cols = NULL,   na.value = NULL,   raster.labels = FALSE,   raster.labels.col = "black",   x.breaks = waiver(),   y.breaks = waiver(),   x.labels = waiver(),   y.labels = waiver(),   labels.col = "black",   x.labels.angle = 0,   y.labels.angle = 0,   x.expand = c(0, 0),   y.expand = c(0, 0),   x.position = "bottom",   y.position = "left",   x.title = NULL,   y.title = NULL,   legend.breaks = NULL,   legend.labels = NULL,   legend.labels.col = "black",   legend.width = unit(0.3, "cm"),   legend.height = unit(0.8, "cm"),   legend.margin = ggplot2::margin(t = -0.02, unit = "npc"),   legend.title = "Scaled Expression",   legend.position = "bottom",   legend.justification = "right",   title = waiver(),   subtitle = waiver(),   caption = waiver(),   text.size = 12,   plot.margin = ggplot2::margin(0.15, 0.15, 0.15, 0.15, "cm") )  cnaplot(   cna,   genome = "hg19",   reorder = FALSE,   reorder.by = NULL,   groups = NULL,   interorder = TRUE,   dist.method = "euclidean",   cluster.method = "complete",   hide = c("21", "Y"),   limits = c(-1, 1),   cols = NULL,   legend.title = "Scaled CNA values",   title = "Copy-number aberrations",   ... )

title: Plot A Heatmap with ggplot2 — ggheatmap
text: dat data.frame tibble plot ggplot. x column name variable mapping x axis. y column name variable mapping y axis. fill column name variable mapping heatmap fill. x.num description y.num description limits color key; replaces bounds values nearest limit. Default: c(-1, 1) limits.find used, auto find value limits plot heatmap. Default: FALSE limits.symmetric Used limits.find. used, set value limits symmetrical. Default: FALSE cols custom color palette (character vector), Default: NULL na.value colot NA value. raster.labels Whether label value heatmap. Default: FALSE raster.labels.col color label heatmap x.breaks, y.breaks breaks scale_x_continuous scale_y_continuous x.labels, y.labels labels scale_x_continuous scale_y_continuous labels.col color x axis y axis label x.labels.angle, y.labels.angle Angle x axis y axis label (\([0, 360]\)) x.expand, y.expand expand scale_x_continuous scale_y_continuous x.position, y.position position scale_x_continuous scale_y_continuous x.title, y.title title x axis y axis legend.breaks breaks scale_fill_gradientn legend.labels labels scale_fill_gradientn legend.labels.col legend label color legend.width legend.width theme legend.height legend.height theme legend.margin legend.margin theme legend.title legend title, Default: NULL legend.position legend.position theme legend.justification legend.justification theme title plot title, Default: 'Copy-number aberrations' subtitle subtitle labs caption caption labs text.size base size text plot plot.margin plot.margin theme cna CNA matrix (genes cells). can generated using Infercna. genome genome annotation order genes. reorder reorder cells using hierarchical clustering, Default: FALSE reorder.reorder cells genes select chromosomes chromosome arms, e.g., c("7", "10", "1p", "19q"). Default: NULL groups groups cells delineate label plot (e.g., cell types, samples, subclones). <reorder> TRUE, ordering performed within groups, Default: NULL interorder reorder hierarchical clustering betweeen groups, Default: TRUE dist.method distance metric reordering, Default: 'euclidean' cluster.method linkage method reordering, Default: 'complete' hide hide x-axis labels specific chromosomes (e.g., small chromosomes whose labels overlap flanking labels), Default: c("21", "Y") ... argument used ggheatmap

title: Plot A Heatmap with ggplot2 — ggheatmap
text: return ggplot2 object return ggplot object

what: Find Malignant Subset of Cells — findMalignant
title: Find Malignant Subset of Cells — findMalignant
text: Find malignant non-malignant subsets cells gene--cell matrix CNA values.

title: Find Malignant Subset of Cells — findMalignant
code: findMalignant(   cna,   refCells = NULL,   samples = NULL,   gene.quantile.for.cor = 0.5,   gene.quantile.for.signal = 0.9,   use.bootstraps = TRUE,   n.bootstraps = 10000,   prob = 0.95,   coverage = 0.8,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Find Malignant Subset of Cells — findMalignant
text: cna matrix gene rows cell columns containing CNA values. refCells character vector list character vectors denoting cell IDs known non-malignant 'Reference' cells (usually used call infercna::infercna correct CNA values). relevant cells CNA matrix. Default: NULL samples character vector unique sample names group cells . relevant multiple tumours represented cna matrix, allows tumour-specific average CNA profiles computed call Infercna::cnaCor. See Details section information. Default: unique_sample_names(colnames(cna)) gene.quantile..cor CNA correlations specifically. Default: gene.quantile gene.quantile..signal CNA signal specifically. Default: gene.quantile use.bootstraps logical; TRUE, function uses bootstrapping method subsample values identify malignant non-malignant groups iteratively. method sensitive differing group sizes, useful believe one group much smaller . Default: TRUE n.bootstraps number bootstrap replicates. Relevant <use.bootstraps> TRUE. Default: 10000 prob numeric value >= 0 <= 1; minimum posterior probability required cell assigned mode. Default: 0.8 coverage fraction cells must posterior probability higher <prob> one two modes order distribution qualify bimodal. Default: 0.8 verbose print progress messages. Default: TRUE ... arguments passed fitBimodal

title: Find Malignant Subset of Cells — findMalignant
text: bimodality found, returns FALSE. bimodality found, returns list containing malignant non-malignant cell IDs.

title: Find Malignant Subset of Cells — findMalignant
text: function attempts fit gaussian bimodal distributions two parameters describe extent CNAs per cell. first CNA correlation cnaCor, measures pearson correlations individual cells' CNA profiles average profile tumours origin. second measure CNA signal cnaSignal, computes cell averages squared CNA values. function assigns cells residing 2nd (higher-value) mode measures malignant, cells residing 1st (low-value) mode measures non-malignant, remaining cells conflicting assignments modes unassigned.

what: Fit a Bimodal Gaussian Distribution — fitBimodal
title: Fit a Bimodal Gaussian Distribution — fitBimodal
text: Fit bimodal gaussian distribution set observations.

title: Fit a Bimodal Gaussian Distribution — fitBimodal
code: fitBimodal(   x,   prob = 0.95,   coverage = 0.8,   size = 10,   assign = FALSE,   boolean = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   maxit = 5000,   maxrestarts = 100,   bySampling = FALSE,   nsamp = 2000,   ... )

title: Fit a Bimodal Gaussian Distribution — fitBimodal
text: x named numeric vector cells/observations matrix genes X cells (variables X observations). latter, column means first computed. prob numeric value >= 0 <= 1; minimum posterior probability required observation assigned mode. Default: 0.95 coverage fraction observations must posterior probability higher <prob> one two modes order distribution qualify bimodal. Default: 0.8 size minimum number observations must assigned mode order distribution qualify bimodal. Default: 10 assign set TRUE, returns list length two containing vector names assigned mode. Default: FALSE boolean set TRUE, returns boolean value indicating whether distribution bimodal. Default: FALSE verbose print progress messages. Default: TRUE maxit maximum number iterations. Default: 5000 maxrestarts maximum number restarts allowed. See normalmixEM details. Default: 100 bySampling logical; TRUE, function uses bootstrapping method subsample values identify two modes iteratively. method sensitive differing mode sizes, useful believe one group much smaller . Default: TRUE nsamp number bootstrap replicates. ... argument methods

title: Fit a Bimodal Gaussian Distribution — fitBimodal
text: posterior probabilities observation one two modes. boolean = TRUE, return boolean value indicating whether bimodality found. assign = TRUE, return list length two observations (IDs) mode.

title: Grouped Reorder and Ungroup — grouped_reorder
text: m matrix reordered groups groups within reordering take place. interorder TRUE, group order reordered groups similar profiles placed near one another. E.g. Samples similar average CNA profiles. Default: FALSE intraorder TRUE, group order reordered groups similar profiles placed near one another. E.g. Samples similar average CNA profiles. Default: TRUE cor.method desired correlation metric. Default: 'pearson' dist.method desired distance metric used top correlation matrix. Default: 'euclidean' cluster.method desired agglomeration method. Default: 'average' Names return vector ordered IDs instead reordered matrix. Default: FALSE

title: Grouped Reorder and Ungroup — grouped_reorder
text: reordered matrix (dimensions input) character vector ordered column names Names = T.

title: Hierarchical clustering analysis — hca
text: Hierarchical clustering analysis

title: Hierarchical clustering analysis — hca
code: hca(   x,   cor.method = cor_methods(),   dist.method = dist_methods(),   cluster.method = cluster_methods(),   max.dist = 1,   h = NULL,   k = NULL,   min.size = 5,   max.size = 0.5 )  hca_cor(   x,   return.steps = F,   reorder = T,   reorder.col = reorder,   reorder.row = reorder,   ... )  hca_dist(x, return.steps = F, ...)  hca_tree(x, return.steps = F, ...)  hca_order(x, return.steps = F, cor.method = "pearson", ...)  hca_groups(x, return.steps = F, ...)  hca_reorder(x, reorder.col = T, reorder.row = T, cor.method = "none", ...)

title: Hierarchical clustering analysis — hca
text: x matrix (features X observations), object class `dist` object class `hclust`. cor.method option <x> matrix. One 'pearson' (default), 'kendall', 'spearman' 'none' (correlation coefficents computed). Default: cor_methods() dist.method option <x> matrix correlation matrix. One 'euclidean' (default), 'maximum', 'manhattan', 'canberra', 'binary', 'minkowski' 'none' (case stats::.dist() used). Default: dist_methods() cluster.method one "average" (default), "complete", "single", "ward.D", "ward.D2", "mcquitty", "median" "centroid". Default: cluster_methods() max.dist maximum distance observations. Default: 1 h height(s) cut tree. NULL, h set tree heights. Default: NULL k number groups return tree. <h> <k> NULL, <k> takes precedence. Default: NULL min.size minimum allowed cluster/group size. Values 0 1 interpreted fractions total count. Groups smaller <min.size> filtered . Default: 5 max.size maximum allowed cluster/group size. Values 0 1 interpreted fractions total count. Groups larger <max.size> filtered.. Default: 0.5 return.steps whether return object specific step, correlation distance matrix. Default: FALSE reorder Whether reorder result. Default: TRUE reorder.col, reorder.row Whether reorder result. set `reorder`, reorder row column. set separately. ... argument `.hca`

title: Hierarchical clustering analysis — hca

what: Split a vector, list, matrix or dataframe into into a list of matrices or nested list according to substring matches. — subsplit
title: Split a vector, list, matrix or dataframe into into a list of matrices or nested list according to substring matches. — subsplit
text: subsplit() divides data 'x' groups defined presence shared substrings. 'x' list, substrings derived 'names(x)'. 'x' matrix data frame, substrings instead derived 'colnames(x)' , '.row=FALSE', 'rownames(x)'.

title: Split a vector, list, matrix or dataframe into into a list of matrices or nested list according to substring matches. — subsplit
code: subsplit(   x,   by.row = FALSE,   sep = "\\.|-|_",   pattern = NULL,   pos = 1,   max.nchar = NULL,   replace = NULL,   na.rm = TRUE )

title: Split a vector, list, matrix or dataframe into into a list of matrices or nested list according to substring matches. — subsplit
text: x character vector, named list, matrix data frame. .row 'TRUE' 'x' matrix data frame, substrings derived 'rownames(x)' instead 'colnames(x)'. Default: FALSE sep pattern split element 'x' . Default: '\.|-|_' pattern substrings split . 'NULL', substrings instead defined delimiter 'sep' position index 'pos' internal call scalop::substri(). Default: NULL pos substring index(es) returned. Default: 1 max.nchar 'NULL', maximum number characters substrings trimmed contain. Default: NULL replace character vector containing two elements. first pattern replaced second pattern replaced . Alternatively, list character vectors, 'NULL' replacement desired. Default: NULL na.rm Remove NA substring positions. Default: TRUE

title: Split a vector, list, matrix or dataframe into into a list of matrices or nested list according to substring matches. — subsplit
text: list type 'x' length equal number unique substrings found.

title: Split a vector, list, matrix or dataframe into into a list of matrices or nested list according to substring matches. — subsplit
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ Names = c(rep('dog.cat', 5), rep('dog', 2), rep('cat', 2), 'frog') x.vec = replicate(expr = sample(100, 5), n = 10, simplify = F) names(x.vec) = Names subsplit(x.vec, pattern = c('dog', 'cat', 'frog')) x.mat = replicate(expr = sample(100, 5), n = 10, simplify = T); colnames(x.mat) = Names subsplit(x.mat) subsplit(x.mat, by.row = T) } # }

what: Extract substrings between delimiters by position — substri
title: Extract substrings between delimiters by position — substri
text: substri splits element 'x' substrings returns desired substring. 'sep' defines delimiters separating strings substrings, input data matches become fields . 'pos' defines substring index(es) returned.

title: Extract substrings between delimiters by position — substri
code: substri(x, sep = "\\.|-|_", pos = 1, max.nchar = NULL, na.rm = TRUE)

title: Extract substrings between delimiters by position — substri
text: x character vector. sep pattern split element 'x' . Default: '\.|-|_' pos substring index(es) returned. Default: 1 max.nchar 'NULL', maximum number characters substrings trimmed contain. Default: NULL na.rm Remove NA substring positions. Default: TRUE

title: Extract substrings between delimiters by position — substri
text: character vector containing extracted substrings.

title: Extract substrings between delimiters by position — substri
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ x = c('dog.cat.mat', 'dog_frog') substri(x) substri(x, pos = 2) substri(x, pos = c(1,3)) substri(x, pos = c(1,3), na.rm = FALSE) substri(x, sep = "-") } # }
